diveRpine 1.0.0
  • Reference

Propagule input into pine plantation by time

disper_time.Rd

It computes the seeds input into focal pine plantation along the time.

disper_time(
  msb,
  mmb,
  mma,
  x,
  xr,
  pp_value,
  per_sb,
  per_mb,
  per_ma,
  propaguleInputBird,
  propaguleInputMammal,
  time_span
)

Arguments

msb

A raster object with small bird contribution on target pine plantation
mmb

A raster object with medium bird contribution on target pine plantation
mma

A raster object with mammal contribution on target pine plantation
x

A raster object with the landscape configured
xr

A raster object with richness computed
pp_value

The value of "Pine plantation" class within the raster (Default value = 1)
per_sb

Percentage of small bird dispersers
per_mb

Percentage of medium bird dispersers
per_ma

Percentage of mammals dispersers
propaguleInputBird

Propagule input by birds (seeds number by year and square meter) (see Zamora et al. 2010)
propaguleInputMammal

Propagule input by mammals (seeds number by year and square meter) (see Zamora et al. 2010)
time_span

Numbers of year simulated (maximum 50)

Details

Compute the propagule input from each natural forest patch to pine plantation target using three types of disperser and different equations. The seed input into focal pine plantation depends on landscape configuration: distance to the seed source and quantity and typology of vegetation patches; and on the composition of the dispersal community. Data about amount of seed introduced into pine plantation in Sierra Nevada mountain (SE Spain) comes from ( Zamora et al. 2010) .

References

Zamora R, Hódar JA, Matías L, Mendoza I (2010). “Positive adjacency effects mediated by seed disperser birds in pine plantations.” Ecological Applications, 20(4), 1053--1060. doi: 10.1890/09-0055.1 .
